attributes

Class DefaultAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • attributes.DefaultAttribute

  • public class DefaultAttribute
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenience class that receives some bytes and delegates it to the correct Attribute. Uses reflection.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String[] attrnames
      The String array that corresponds to the classnames variable.
      static java.lang.Class[] classnames
      The classes which correspond to the attrnames variable This is used for reflection.
      ConstantPool cp
      The ConstantPool which information is parsed from
      (package private) int length
      The length of the attribute Not generally very helpful
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<? extends Attribute>> map
      The Hash that binds together the attrnames and classnames variables.
      (package private) java.lang.String name
      The name itself, which must be resolved
      (package private) short nameindex
      The index into the ConstantPool that corresponds to the name
      (package private) byte[] remains
      The byte array that the Attribute lies in

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultAttribute(short nindex, int length, byte[] remainder, ConstantPool cp)
      Simple constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Attribute getAttribute()
      Actual implementation of reflection involving the attrnames, classnames, and map variables.
      java.lang.Class<? extends Attribute> getNameClass(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the Class from a String, which aids in reflection
      private void initHash()
      A method that maps the Strings of attrnames and the Classes of classnames The result is put into the variable map, and not returned.
      private java.lang.String parseName(int ind, ConstantPool cp)
      A method that returns the name from the nindex variable

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • nameindex

        short nameindex
        The index into the ConstantPool that corresponds to the name

      • name

        java.lang.String name
        The name itself, which must be resolved

      • length

        int length
        The length of the attribute Not generally very helpful

      • remains

        byte[] remains
        The byte array that the Attribute lies in

      • cp

        public final ConstantPool cp
        The ConstantPool which information is parsed from

      • attrnames

        public static final java.lang.String[] attrnames
        The String array that corresponds to the classnames variable. Simply lists the supported values of the name variable If an attribute name is not in here, it will not be supported One part of the map hash.

      • classnames

        public static final java.lang.Class[] classnames
        The classes which correspond to the attrnames variable This is used for reflection. They all have to have the constructor (byte[],ConstantPool). One part of the map hash.

      • map

        public final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<? extends Attribute>> map
        The Hash that binds together the attrnames and classnames variables. Used in order to make reflection possible.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultAttribute

        public DefaultAttribute(short nindex,
                int length,
                byte[] remainder,
                ConstantPool cp)
        Simple constructor.
        Parameters:
        nindex - the index into the ConstantPool of the Attribute name
        length - the length of this attribute
        remainder - the byte array that information will come from
        cp - the ConstantPool

    • Method Detail

      • initHash

        private void initHash()
        A method that maps the Strings of attrnames and the Classes of classnames The result is put into the variable map, and not returned.

      • parseName

        private java.lang.String parseName(int ind,
                         ConstantPool cp)
        A method that returns the name from the nindex variable
        Parameters:
        ind - the name index
        cp - the ConstantPool
        Returns:
        the String representation of an Attribute

      • getNameClass

        public java.lang.Class<? extends Attribute> getNameClass(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the Class from a String, which aids in reflection
        Parameters:
        name - the name to parse. If this doesn't exist, I think java.lang.Object shows up.
        Returns:
        the class

      • getAttribute

        public Attribute getAttribute()
        Actual implementation of reflection involving the attrnames, classnames, and map variables. If the name doesn't exist, null will be returned. Uses a constructor with the type (byte[],ConstantPool)
        Returns:
        the Attribute corresponding to the name
